cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles SSW of Caibarién, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to move northwest across the Florida Straits, track up the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle, then curve inland through AL/GA and weaken while lifting into the Ohio and lower Great-Lakes region mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle (near the Big Bend/Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Englewood FL south and east to Ocean Reef FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, entire west coast of Florida, Florida Panhandle, then inland Southeast U.S.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed (no Ohio locations in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (most guidance shows 1–3 inches possible this far north)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (fresh-water port on Lake Erie, no coastal surge exposure)
weather_observation.wind: Sub-gale winds (generally <30 mph) possible as remnant depression passes nearby mid-week
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to locally heavy rain could cause ponding and minor river rises
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated thunderstorms and brief low-visibility squalls could interrupt cargo handling operations
